message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.CR

This paper deals with the problem of designing interventions to mitigate implicit bias in ranking, which is a central primitive in various social and computational contexts. The paper presents a mathematical model for implicit bias and proposes a family of simple and interpretable constraints to optimally mitigate it. The paper also provides empirical findings on real-world datasets. Given the focus on machine learning and algorithms, as well as the use of mathematical models and empirical analysis, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CY (Computers and Society), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
